article:
# Recipe: Instapot Vegetable Soup

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Ingredients](#ingredients)
- [Equipment](#equipment)
- [Preparation Time](#preparation-time)
- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)
- [Steps](#steps)
- [Serving Suggestions](#serving-suggestions)
- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Instapot Vegetable Soup is a hearty and nutritious dish that is perfect for a comforting meal. Packed with a variety of vegetables, this soup is not only delicious but also a great way to incorporate more veggies into your diet. It can be customized with your favorite vegetables and spices, making it a versatile and flexible recipe.

## Ingredients
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, diced
- 2 celery stalks, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup corn kernels
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Fresh parsley, for garnish

## Equipment
- Instant Pot or pressure cooker
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Wooden spoon or spatula

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 15 minutes (plus time for the Instant Pot to come to pressure and release pressure)

## Steps
1. Turn on the Instant Pot and select the sauté function. Heat the olive oil in the pot.
2. Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pot. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion becomes translucent.
3. Add the diced carrots, celery, bell pepper, zucchini, and corn kernels to the pot. Sauté for another 3-4 minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
4. Pour in the diced tomatoes and vegetable broth. Add the dried thyme and oregano. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Stir everything together and secure the lid on the Instant Pot. Set the pressure release valve to the sealing position.
6. Select the manual or pressure cook function and set the timer for 5 minutes on high pressure.
7. Once the cooking time is complete, allow for a natural pressure release for 5 minutes, then carefully switch the pressure release valve to the venting position to release any remaining pressure.
8. Remove the lid and give the soup a stir. Taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
9. Ladle the vegetable soup into bowls and garnish with fresh parsley.
10. Serve hot and enjoy!

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Instapot Vegetable Soup with crusty bread or a side of cooked quinoa for a more filling meal.
- Top the soup with a dollop of sour cream or a sprinkle of grated Parmesan cheese for added creaminess and flavor.

## Variations
- Feel free to add or substitute any vegetables based on your preference. Some great options include mushrooms, peas, spinach, or sweet potatoes.
- For a protein boost, add cooked chickpeas or lentils to the soup.
- Customize the flavors by adding spices like paprika, cumin, or chili powder.

## Tips and Tricks
- To save time, you can use pre-cut vegetables or frozen mixed vegetables.
- For a richer flavor, sauté the vegetables for a few extra minutes until they start to caramelize.
- Make a larger batch and freeze the leftovers in individual portions for quick and easy meals.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information for this recipe may vary based on the specific ingredients used. Here is a general breakdown per serving:
  - Calories: 150
  - Fat: 4g
  - Carbohydrates: 25g
  - Fiber: 5g
  - Protein: 4g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftover Instapot Vegetable Soup in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.
- Reheat the soup on the stovetop or in the microwave until heated through before serving.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Q: Can I use a regular stovetop pot instead of an Instant Pot?
  - A: Yes, you can make this vegetable soup in a regular stovetop pot. Simply follow the same steps and adjust the cooking time accordingly. Simmer the soup for about 20-25 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.

- Q: Can I use chicken broth instead of vegetable broth?
  - A: Yes, you can substitute chicken broth for vegetable broth if you prefer a non-vegetarian version of the soup.
